\begin{soln}
  By the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality:
  \[
    \int_0^1 f(x)\mathrm{d}x \int_0^1 f(1-x)\mathrm{d}x
    \geq \left( \int_0^1 \sqrt{f(x)f(1-x)} \mathrm dx \right)^2
  .\]
  Since
  \[
    \int_0^1 \sqrt{f(x)f(1-x)} \mathrm dx
    = \int_0^1 1 \mathrm dx = 1
  ,\]
  we have
  \[
    \int_0^1 f(x)\mathrm{d}x \int_0^1 f(1-x)\mathrm{d}x \geq 1
  .\]
  By King's rule:
  \[
    \int_0^1 f(x)\mathrm{d}x \int_0^1 f(1-x)\mathrm{d}x
    = \int_0^1 f(x)\mathrm{d}x \int_0^1 f(x)\mathrm{d}x
    = \left( \int_0^1 f(x) \mathrm dx \right)^2
  .\]
  Thus:
  \[
    \left( \int_0^1 f(x) \mathrm dx \right)^2 \geq 1
  .\]
  Taking the square root:
  \[
    \int_0^1 f(x) \mathrm dx \geq 1.\qedhere
  \]
\end{soln}
